title: Human Beta Cell Line
description: A human beta cell line biosample derived from pancreatic beta cells, specifically designed for diabetes and pancreatic function research.

time_post_library_delivery.comment: Specification of time_post_library_delivery requires time_post_library_delivery_units and construct_library_sets.

time_post_library_delivery_units.comment: Specification of time_post_library_delivery_units requires time_post_library_delivery and construct_library_sets.

lower_bound_age.comment: A biosample with a defined lower_bound_age requires upper_bound_age and age_units.

upper_bound_age.comment: A biosample with a defined upper_bound_age requires lower_bound_age and age_units.

age_units.comment: A biosample with defined age_units requires lower_bound_age and upper_bound_age.

status.comment: Release, archived and revoked status should have release_timestamp specified.

release_timestamp.comment: Release timestamp is required if status is released, revoked or archived.

passage_number.comment: A cell line biosample with passage_number requires growth_medium.

release_timestamp.title: Release Timestamp
release_timestamp.description: The date the object was released.
release_timestamp.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is released is assigned by the server.

publication_identifiers.title: Publication Identifiers
publication_identifiers.description: The publication identifiers that provide more information about the object.

items.title: Publication Identifier
items.description: A publication identifier that provides more information about the object.

url.title: URL
url.description: An external resource with additional information.

items.title: Source
items.comment: See source.json or lab.json for available identifiers.

lot_id.title: Lot ID
lot_id.description: The lot identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

product_id.title: Product ID
product_id.description: The product identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents that provide additional information (not data file).

items.title: Document
items.description: A document that provides additional information (not data file).

lab.title: Lab
lab.comment: Required. See lab.json for list of available identifiers.

award.title: Award
award.comment: Required. See award.json for list of available identifiers.

accession.title: Accession
accession.description: A unique identifier to be used to reference the object prefixed with PKB.
accession.comment: Do not submit. The accession is assigned by the server.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate Accessions
alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

collections.title: Collections
collections.description: Some samples are part of particular data collections.
collections.comment: Do not submit. Collections are for DACC use only.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the metadata object.
status.comment: Do not submit.  This is set by admins along the process of metadata submission.

revoke_detail.title: Revoke Detail
revoke_detail.description: Explanation of why an object was transitioned to the revoked status.
revoke_detail.comment: Do not submit. This is set by admins when an object is revoked.

schema_version.title: Schema Version
schema_version.description: The version of the JSON schema that the server uses to validate the object.
schema_version.comment: Do not submit. The version used to validate the object is set by the server. The default should be set to the current version.

uuid.title: UUID
uuid.description: The unique identifier associated with every object.
uuid.comment: Do not submit. The uuid is set by the server.

notes.title: Notes
notes.comment: Do not submit. A place for the DACC to keep information that does not have a place in the schema.

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.description: Lab specific identifiers to reference an object.
aliases.comment: The purpose of this field is to provide a link into the lab LIMS and to facilitate shared objects.

items.title: Lab Alias
items.description: A lab specific identifier to reference an object.
items.comment: Current convention is colon separated lab name and lab identifier. (e.g. john-doe:42).

creation_timestamp.title: Creation Timestamp
creation_timestamp.description: The date the object was created.
creation_timestamp.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is created is assigned by the server.

submitted_by.title: Submitted By
submitted_by.description: The user who submitted the object.
submitted_by.comment: Do not submit. The user that created the object is assigned by the server.

submitter_comment.title: Submitter Comment
submitter_comment.description: Additional information specified by the submitter to be displayed as a comment on the portal.

description.title: Description
description.description: A plain text description of the object.

lower_bound_age.title: Lower Bound Age
lower_bound_age.description: Lower bound of age of the organism at the time of collection of the sample.
lower_bound_age.comment: To submit a biosample with a singular, defined age lower_bound_age and upper_bound_age should be equal. For samples from human donors older than 89 years, the lower bound of age has to be 90 and upper bound has to be 90, for de-identification purposes.

upper_bound_age.title: Upper Bound Age
upper_bound_age.description: Upper bound of age of the organism at the time of collection of the sample.
upper_bound_age.comment: To submit a biosample with a singular, defined age lower_bound_age and upper_bound_age should be equal. For samples from human donors older than 89 years, the lower bound of age has to be 90 and upper bound has to be 90, for de-identification purposes.

age_units.title: Age Units
age_units.description: The units of time associated with age of the biosample.

disease_terms.title: Disease Terms
disease_terms.description: Ontology term of the disease associated with the biosample.
disease_terms.comment: This property should only be used to submit existing known diseases, and not any phenotypic trait.

pooled_from.title: Biosamples Pooled From
pooled_from.description: The biosamples this biosample is pooled from.

part_of.title: Part of Biosample
part_of.description: Links to a biosample which represents a larger sample from which this sample was taken regardless of whether it is a tissue taken from an organism or smaller slices of a piece of tissue or aliquots of a cell growth.
part_of.comment: For differentiation, reprogramming, or introduction of a genetic modification use `originated_from` instead. Biosample parts should have identical metadata properties as their parent.

originated_from.title: Originated From
originated_from.description: Links to a biosample that was originated from due to differentiation, dedifferentiation, reprogramming, or the introduction of a genetic modification.

treatments.title: Treatments
treatments.description: A list of treatments applied to the biosample with the purpose of perturbation.

donors.title: Donors
donors.description: Donor(s) the sample was derived from.

items.title: Donor
items.comment: See concrete class human_donor.json or rodent_donor.json for available identifiers.

biomarkers.title: Biomarkers
biomarkers.description: Biological markers that are associated with this sample.

modifications.title: Modifications
modifications.description: Links to modifications applied to this biosample.

items.title: Modification
items.description: Link to a modification applied to this biosample.

cellular_sub_pool.title: Cellular Sub Pool
cellular_sub_pool.description: Cellular sub-pool fraction of the sample. Also known as PKR and sub-library.
cellular_sub_pool.comment: Barcodes coming from different cellular sub-pools could not be directly comparable due to the higher probability of collisions. Examples of valid identifiers are: 8A, LW231-2, SS-PKR_1, 4e.AB(678), etc.

starting_amount.title: Starting Amount
starting_amount.description: The initial quantity of samples obtained.
starting_amount.comment: A sample with starting_amount must include starting_amount_units.

starting_amount_units.title: Starting Amount Units
starting_amount_units.description: The units used to quantify the amount of samples obtained.
starting_amount_units.comment: A sample with starting_amount_units must include starting_amount.

dbxrefs.title: External Resources
dbxrefs.description: Biosample identifiers from external resources, such as Biosample database or Cellosaurus.
dbxrefs.comment: Do not submit. DCC personnel is responsible for submission of biosample external resource identifiers.

date_obtained.title: Date Obtained
date_obtained.description: The date the sample was harvested, dissected or created, depending on the type of the sample.
date_obtained.comment: Date should be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD.

sorted_from.title: Sorted From
sorted_from.description: Links to a larger sample from which this sample was obtained through sorting.
sorted_from.comment: The parent sample is expected to have similar properties to its fraction. A sample with sorted_from must include sorted_from_detail.

sorted_from_detail.title: Sorted From Detail
sorted_from_detail.description: Detail for sample sorted into fractions capturing information about sorting.
sorted_from_detail.comment: A sample with sorted_from_detail must include sorted_from.

virtual.title: Virtual
virtual.description: Virtual samples are not representing actual physical entities from experiments, but rather capturing metadata about hypothetical samples that the reported analysis results are relevant for.
virtual.comment: For example, a prediction of a certain TF's binding profile in HepG2 cells should not be associated with an actual batch of HepG2 cells, but with a virtual sample of HepG2 cells, making it clear that the reported prediction is not directly associated with an actual HepG2 sample in a specific lab and experiment.

construct_library_sets.title: Construct Library Sets
construct_library_sets.description: The construct library sets of vectors introduced to this sample prior to performing an assay.

moi.title: Multiplicity Of Infection
moi.description: The actual multiplicity of infection (MOI) for vectors introduced to this sample. At least one construct library set must be specified in order to specify MOI. This property should capture the actual MOI, and not the targeted MOI.
moi.comment: Use of this property requires construct_library_sets.

nucleic_acid_delivery.title: Nucleic Acid Delivery
nucleic_acid_delivery.description: Method of introduction of nucleic acid into the cell.

time_post_library_delivery.title: Time Post Library Delivery
time_post_library_delivery.description: The time that elapsed past the time-point when the construct library sets were introduced.
time_post_library_delivery.comment: Use of this property requires time_post_library_delivery_units and construct_library_sets.

time_post_library_delivery_units.title: Time Post Library Delivery Units
time_post_library_delivery_units.description: The units of time that elapsed past the point when the construct library sets were introduced.
time_post_library_delivery_units.comment: Use of this property requires time_post_library_delivery and construct_library_sets.

protocols.title: Protocols
protocols.description: Links to the protocol(s) for preparing the samples on Protocols.io.

sample_name.title: Sample Name
sample_name.description: Text-based term identifying the cell line (e.g. EndoC-Bh1, EndoC-Bh2, EndoC-Bh3).

classifications.title: Classifications
classifications.description: Type of cell (cell line only option, used for compatibility with other schemas).

growth_medium.title: Growth Medium
growth_medium.description: Growth media used in the in vitro system to culture cell line biosample.

submissionExample.appscript: CMRL-1066 medium supplemented with 10% FBS and 1% penicillin/streptomycin
submissionExample.igvf_utils: CMRL-1066 medium supplemented with 10% FBS and 1% penicillin/streptomycin

date_harvested.title: Date Harvested
date_harvested.description: Date sample was harvested for assay.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: Method for authentication performed on cell line biosample.

file_sets.title: File Sets
file_sets.description: The file sets linked to this sample.

parts.title: Parts
parts.description: The parts into which this sample has been divided.

pooled_in.title: Pooled In
pooled_in.description: The pooled samples in which this sample is included.

demultiplexed_to.title: Demultiplexed To
demultiplexed_to.description: The parts into which this sample has been demultiplexed.

multiplexed_in.title: Multiplexed In
multiplexed_in.description: The multiplexed samples this sample is part of.

sorted_fractions.title: Sorted Fractions
sorted_fractions.description: The fractions into which this sample has been sorted.

origin_of.title: Origin Sample Of
origin_of.description: The samples which originate from this sample, such as through a process of cell differentiation.

institutional_certificates.title: Institutional Certificates
institutional_certificates.description: The institutional certificates under which use of this sample is approved.

age.title: Age
age.description: Age of organism at the time of collection of the sample.

upper_bound_age_in_hours.title: Upper Bound Age In Hours
upper_bound_age_in_hours.description: Upper bound of age of organism in hours at the time of collection of the sample.

lower_bound_age_in_hours.title: Lower Bound Age In Hours
lower_bound_age_in_hours.description: Lower bound of age of organism in hours at the time of collection of the sample .
